definitions: To successfully make contact with someone, usually by phone.
To successfully complete or finish something difficult or long.
To use up or consume all of something.
To manage to survive or deal with a difficult period or experience.
examples: I tried to call her all morning, but I couldn't get through.
We need to get through all this paperwork by Friday.
They got through a whole loaf of bread in one day.
I don't know how I'm going to get through this exam.
It's hard to get through to him sometimes.
